question_sentence: The US imposed a 25% additional tariff on which country as a punitive measure for importing Russian oil?
evidence: Imposing the 25% penalty tariff, Donald Trump accused India of "buying massive amounts of Russian oil" and "selling it on the open market for big profits". India's foreign ministry said the punitive measures, which in addition to existing tariffs will see levies on Indian exports to the US rise as high as 50%, were "unjustified and unreasonable".

question_sentence: A cholera-related bacteria has killed billions of which sea creature?
evidence: A bacteria related to cholera was found to be behind the deaths of over five billion sea stars along the Pacific Coast of North America since 2013. The disease devastated more than 20 species, with sunflower sea stars hit hardest, losing over 90% of their population.

question_sentence: Israel's national security minister, Itamar Ben-Gvir, caused controversy by publicly praying at which site?
evidence: Ben-Gvir, a hardliner in Benjamin Netanyahu's cabinet, led a group of more than 1,000 worshippers in prayer and singing outside the Al Aqsa Mosque, on top of Temple Mount. Believed to be the location of King Solomon's temple, the hill in the heart of Jerusalem's Old City is home to holy sites for Muslims and Jews.

question_sentence: The US has lowered the minimum age for new immigration enforcement officers to what?
evidence: The Department of Homeland Security has changed the minimum age requirement and is now accepting applications from anyone 18 years or older to become an ICE agent, in a bid to quickly hire 10,000 new recruits. Previously, applicants were required to be between 21 and 40 years old.

question_sentence: The NHS has begun a world-first rollout of a vaccine for which sexually transmitted disease?
evidence: A new vaccine reduces the risk of infection by up to 40%, and has been rolled out in sexual health clinics nationwide starting this week. Last year, 71,802 people in England were diagnosed with gonorrhoea, amid a rise in antibiotic-resistant strains of the sexually transmitted disease.

question_sentence: Depletion of which element in the brain may contribute to Alzheimer's disease, according to new research?
evidence: Researchers from Harvard Medical School found that lithium depletion in the brain plays a key role in the development of Alzheimer's disease. The study also showed that small doses of lithium could reverse memory loss in ageing mice.

question_sentence: A livestream of a deep-sea submarine expedition has become an unexpected sensation in which country?
evidence: The footage from the exploration of the Mar del Plata gorge, off the coast of Buenos Aires, was meant only for marine biologists – but it has been attracting more than 1.6 million views a day on YouTube, and dominating TV news broadcasts. Find out more in this week's episode of The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which city has been deemed the world's most stressful for visitors?
evidence: The City of Light was ranked the world's most stressful city to visit. The city crams more than 47 million annual visitors into just 40 square miles, making it even more densely touristed than New York City.

question_sentence: Which Rolling Stones member is in dispute with New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art over a "stolen" guitar?
evidence: Taylor claims that Keith Richards gave him the 1959 Gibson Les Paul in 1967, and that he recognised it when the museum unveiled it in May by its distinctive "starburst" finish. The museum says the guitar was owned by Richards until 1971, but that it has no evidence that it had ever belonged to Taylor.

question_sentence: A mascot for the Seattle Kraken ice hockey team had a close encounter with which animal during a video shoot in Alaska?
evidence: The team's blue-haired troll mascot, along with a player and film crew, were fly-fishing in Alaska's Katmai National Park for a youth ice hockey promo video when a brown bear suddenly charged toward them. The bear abruptly stopped and turned away as the mascot and film crew returned to shore.

question_sentence: President Donald Trump’s new tariffs are now in effect. Which country was hit with the highest tariff rate?
evidence: Brazil’s rate of 50% is the highest of any country, despite the US running a trade surplus with the country last year.

question_sentence: Which of the following flavors does Doritos think will be the next “Cool Ranch”?
evidence: The tortilla chips maker thinks it’s found the next big flavor with “Golden Sriracha” — a newly released permanent addition that the brand hopes will emulate the popularity of Cool Ranch and Nacho Cheese.

question_sentence: The House Oversight Committee issued nearly a dozen subpoenas this week seeking information related to which of the following?
evidence: The subpoenas ask that all files related to Jeffrey Epstein at the Justice Department — as well as any communications between former Biden administration officials and the DOJ related to the case — be handed over to Congress.

question_sentence: Which tactic did Democrats in Texas use to block state lawmakers from voting on a GOP-drawn congressional map this week?
evidence: Texas House Democrats left the state in a desperate bid to block an aggressively partisan redrawing of the state’s congressional map orchestrated by Republicans with the support of President Trump. The Texas Constitution requires two-thirds of the state House to be present to conduct legislative business.

question_sentence: The Trump administration is making plans to increase the federal law enforcement presence in which city?
evidence: The move comes after a former DOGE employee was assaulted during an attempted carjacking in the district.

question_sentence: Which blaze is now the largest wildfire in California this year?
evidence: The Gifford Fire has already consumed tens of thousands of acres in Santa Barbara and San Luis Obispo counties since igniting last week.

question_sentence: Dozens of people in New York City have been diagnosed with Legionnaires’ disease. Where do authorities suspect the bacteria that cause the disease originated from?
evidence: A cooling tower is a rooftop device that releases mist into the air as it cools a large building. If the water inside becomes too warm, stagnant or isn’t properly disinfected, Legionella bacteria can grow and sicken people who inhale the mist.

question_sentence: What is in a “cortisol cocktail,” the wellness hack that’s been trending on TikTok and Instagram?
choices: Coconut water, citrus juice and salts
Sour cherry juice and apple cider vinegar
Milk, bananas, peanut butter and honey
evidence: Cortisol cocktails are nonalcoholic drinks that contain a mixture of coconut water, citrus juice and certain salts. However, there is no scientific evidence that drinking the beverage lowers stress hormones, boosts energy or balances a body’s adrenal function.

question_sentence: Which artist received the most 2025 MTV Video Music Awards nominations?
evidence: Lady Gaga leads this year’s nominations with 12, including nods in the video of the year, artist of the year and best album categories.

question_sentence: How long is the extremely elusive Barbados threadsnake?
evidence: Growing to a length of just 3 to 4 inches, the Barbados threadsnake is the world’s smallest snake.
